workflow.name: Generate and send AI news newsletters automatically with GPT & Gmail
workflow.description:
**Description:**

Automate your AI newsletter creation and delivery using this ready-to-deploy n8n workflow template. Powered by GPT (OpenAI/Azure) and integrated with Gmail, this workflow generates rich, structured, and engaging AI-focused newsletters and sends them out daily or weekly‚Äîcompletely hands-free.

**What It Does:**

- üì∞ Fetches the latest AI trends and updates using GPT
- ‚úçÔ∏è Automatically formats news into structured newsletter sections: headlines, tools, stats, tips, and more
- üìß Sends HTML email newsletters via Gmail
- üïò Runs automatically at your chosen schedule (default: 9 AM daily)

**Setup Includes:**

Connect your OpenAI or Azure GPT API
Add Gmail SMTP or OAuth credentials
Customize categories, schedule, and email styling

**Perfect for:**

Tech bloggers, content marketers, AI influencers, and automation enthusiasts who want to send curated AI content to their audience without manual effort.

parameters.content:
## Daily AI News Summary Workflow

This workflow runs every day at 9 AM to:

1. **Fetch Latest AI News**: Uses Perplexity to find recent AI developments
2. **Categorize Content**: Organizes news into three key areas:
   - üöÄ New Technology (breakthroughs, models, research)
   - üí° Tips & Tricks (practical applications, tutorials)
   - üõ°Ô∏è AI Ethics & Security (privacy, safety, regulations)
3. **Format & Send**: Creates a beautiful HTML email with summaries and links

### Setup Required:
- Perplexity API credentials
- SMTP email credentials
- Update recipient email address

### Customization:
- Change schedule time in Daily Trigger
- Modify categories in Perplexity prompt
- Adjust email styling in Format Email Content node

‚öôÔ∏è **Configuration Needed:**

1. **AI Agent**: Add your Chat Model API key to the "AI Agent"

2. **Email Settings**: 
   - Add your Gmail Credentials
   - Add subject and message seperately
   - Email should be in HTML format

3. **Timing**: Modify schedule in "Daily Trigger" if you want different timing

4. **Content**: Customize the news categories or add more in the AI Agent prompt

parameters.text:
=Newsletter Structure
1. Title
Engaging and punchy (under 10 words).

Includes a relevant keyword (e.g., ‚ÄúAI‚Äù, ‚ÄúChatGPT‚Äù, ‚ÄúMachine Learning‚Äù).

2. Editor‚Äôs Note (Optional but preferred)
A short 2‚Äì3 sentence personal note to the readers.

Tone: Conversational and warm.

Summarize the theme of this issue or highlight an AI trend to watch.

3. üß† AI in Focus (Main Story)
One key development or trend in AI this week.

Could be about a breakthrough, a major product launch, a regulatory move, or a case study.

3‚Äì5 paragraphs long.

Include context (why it matters), impact, and your analysis.

4. üì∞ Headlines in AI (News Roundup)
List 3‚Äì5 bite-sized headlines with 1‚Äì2 sentence summaries for each. Include:

Date (optional).

Source (e.g., OpenAI, Google, MIT, etc.).

Link (if available).

Example:

OpenAI Releases GPT-5 Preview ‚Äì OpenAI teased major upgrades in language understanding and reasoning. Read more

5. üîç Tool of the Week
Introduce one new or underrated AI tool.

Include what it does, who it‚Äôs for, and how it works (2‚Äì3 sentences).

Include a link if available.

6. üìö Learning Corner
Recommend one AI resource: a blog post, YouTube video, podcast, free course, or paper.

Mention why it‚Äôs worth reading/listening/watching.

7. ü§ñ Prompt of the Week
Share a powerful or creative prompt users can try with ChatGPT or any LLM.

Explain what it does and when to use it.

8. üìà AI Stat of the Week
Share one interesting stat about AI.

Cite the source and explain the takeaway in 1‚Äì2 sentences.

9. üë• Community Shoutout (Optional)
Highlight a person, open-source project, or discussion in the AI community.

10. üëÄ What to Watch Next Week
Preview an upcoming event, release, or expected trend in AI.

Keep it short (1‚Äì2 sentences).

üßæ Style Guidelines
Use markdown for formatting: **bold**, # headers, - lists, etc.

Keep tone informative, clear, and slightly casual.

Avoid jargon unless explained.

Use bullet points and subheaders for readability.

Provide citations for all the topics immediately

options.systemMessage: You are an AI writing assistant tasked with creating a weekly newsletter about artificial intelligence (AI). The goal is to inform, engage, and educate readers ranging from tech-savvy professionals to curious enthusiasts. Follow the structure below and ensure the tone is professional yet accessible.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.
